item.title: Anna add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "If I had a world of my own, everything would be nonsense. Nothing would be what it is, because everything would be what it isn't. And contrary wise, what is, it wouldn't be. And what it wouldn't be, it would. You see?" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Anna add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Anna add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Where should I go?" -Alice. "That depends on where you want to end up." - The Cheshire Cat." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Anna add a quote by The Cheshire Cat
item.description: "Only a few find the way, some don't recognize it when they do - some... don't ever want to." -- The Cheshire Cat

item.title: Anna add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Alice: Would you tell me, please, which way I ought to go from here? The Cheshire Cat: That depends a good deal on where you want to get to. Alice: I don't much care where. The Cheshire Cat: Then it doesn't much matter which way you go. Alice: ...So long as I get somewhere. The Cheshire Cat: Oh, you're sure to do that, if only you walk long enough." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Anna add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "And above all, watch with glittering eyes the whole world around you because the greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places. Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Anna add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "Once a little boy sent me a charming card with a little drawing on it. I loved it. I answer all my children’s letters — sometimes very hastily — but this one I lingered over. I sent him a card and I drew a picture of a Wild Thing on it. I wrote, “Dear Jim: I loved your card.” Then I got a letter back from his mother and she said, “Jim loved your card so much he ate it.” That to me was one of the highest compliments I’ve ever received. He didn’t care that it was an original Maurice Sendak drawing or anything. He saw it, he loved it, he ate it." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Anna add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "And Max, the king of all wild things, was lonely and wanted to be where someone loved him best of all." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Anna add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "there is no such thing as fantasy unrelated to reality" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Anna add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Anna add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "We are travelers on a cosmic journey,stardust,swirling and dancing in the eddies and whirlpools of infinity. Life is eternal. We have stopped for a moment to encounter each other, to meet, to love, to share.This is a precious moment. It is a little parenthesis in eternity." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Anna add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Anna add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The very essence of romance is uncertainty." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Anna add a quote by Oscar Wilde (attributed to)
item.description: "Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go." -- Oscar Wilde (attributed to)

item.title: Anna add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Anna add a quote by George Harrison
item.description: "If you don't know where you're going, any road'll take you there" -- George Harrison

item.title: Anna add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "I can't go back to yesterday because I was a different person then." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Anna add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Begin at the beginning," the King said, very gravely, "and go on till you come to the end: then stop." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Anna add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "I can't explain myself, I'm afraid, sir,' said Alice, 'Because I'm not myself you see." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Anna add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "It would be so nice if something made sense for a change." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Anna add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Anna add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Anna add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "If people bring so much courage to this world the world has to kill them to break them, so of course it kills them. The world breaks every one and afterward many are strong at the broken places. But those that will not break it kills. It kills the very good and the very gentle and the very brave impartially. If you are none of these you can be sure it will kill you too but there will be no special hurry." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Anna add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Road to hell paved in unbought stuffed dogs. Not my fault." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Anna add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "In order to write about life first you must live it." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Anna add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "Let there be spaces in your togetherness, And let the winds of the heavens dance between you. Love one another but make not a bond of love: Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls. Fill each other's cup but drink not from one cup. Give one another of your bread but eat not from the same loaf. Sing and dance together and be joyous, but let each one of you be alone, Even as the strings of a lute are alone though they quiver with the same music. Give your hearts, but not into each other's keeping. For only the hand of Life can contain your hearts. And stand together, yet not too near together: For the pillars of the temple stand apart, And the oak tree and the cypress grow not in each other's shadow." -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Anna add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Anna add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "To understand the heart and mind of a person, look not at what he has already achieved, but at what he aspires to." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Anna add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "There is only one thing that makes a dream impossible to achieve: the fear of failure." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Anna add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Everyone seems to have a clear idea of how other people should lead their lives, but none about his or her own." -- Paulo Coelho
